entry.title: Crystal Reports 2008: Cannot use linked parameter for subreport group sorting.
entry.content:
Component: BI-RA-CR (Business Intelligence - Reporting & Analysis - Crystal Reports)

Priority: High (business impact).

Description:

We are using a main report to execute a single stored procedure (Process_Info) for performance optimization. The goal is to avoid multiple database calls by having the main report retrieve all necessary data and then pass it to three different subreports. Each subreport requires its own unique sorting and grouping order.

We have attempted to implement this by linking data fields from the main report to each of the subreports. However, we have found a critical limitation: a parameter or field linked from the main report to a subreport is not available in the subreport's Group Expert for sorting.

Problem Replication:

  1. Create a main report and a sub report.

  2. Connect the main report to a SQL server stored procedure that returns a dataset.

  3. Create a parameter in the sub report that corresponds to a field from the main report's data source.

  4. In the main report, right-click the subreport and link a data field (e.g., Chrono_DT or Unit_Procedure) from the main report's data source to the parameter created in the subreport.

  5. Go to the subreport and open the Group Expert.

  6. The linked parameter is not available in the list of fields that can be used for grouping or sorting.

Business Impact:

This limitation forces us to either:

  1. Create separate database connections for each subreport, which results in multiple redundant database calls and significantly increases report execution time.

Request:

We need a definitive solution or a product fix that allows us to use a linked parameter or field from a main report to define the grouping and sorting order in a subreport. This is a critical requirement for maintaining report performance and an efficient report architecture. Please escalate this to the appropriate product management or development team for resolution.

Thanks In advance.

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 交货单&发票打印-自定义合作伙伴地址
entry.content:
Hello @Joey3 

感谢您的澄清。
更多详情请参阅《输出管理与3008187 - SAP S/4HANA云公共版采购订单输出管理》。
但简而言之，在公共云环境中无法像本地部署那样通过自定义交易伙伴功能增强交易伙伴确定机制。您仅能使用输出表单中预设的标准交易伙伴角色集，因此无法使用ZS第三方供应商选项。
在公共云环境中可考虑以下方案：
• 通过自定义字段与逻辑应用程序，或利用输出管理提供的BAdI扩展表单数据源。详见文档3008187 - SAP S/4HANA云公共版采购订单输出管理
• 在输出结构中获取数据后，可修改Adobe表单。添加ZS第三方供应商字段并将其绑定至增强数据。
若需避免BAdI编码，可将供应商地址存储于交货发票文档头部的自定义字段中。该字段可通过自定义字段应用程序→UI与报表→输出表单进行展示，确保数据直接流入表单而无需扩展合作伙伴功能。
此致
克里斯

Output Management & 3008187 - Purchase Order Output Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Translated using GenAi

entry.title: Purchase Request Decision Note CDS requirement
entry.content:
There is a CDS requirement that allows us to read the value written in the decision note field that appears after the rejection of purchase requests.

As CDS, we can display the values I_WorkflowTaskResult and I_WorkflowTaskResultComment, but these also appear to be disabled.

We kindly request your suggestions and support.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Purchase Request Decision Note CDS requirement
entry.content:
Hi,

I am afraid the functionality is not available for purchase requisitions.
The documentation for email notifications for purchase requisitions is here: 
For purchase requisition approvals and rejections the data source C_WORKFLOWTASK is defined which does not include the 
rejection comments. The functionality is available for purchase orders where the data source C_PURORDWORKFLOWAPPROVALEMAIL is defined but not purchase requisitions. 

If you feel that the SAP S/4Hana public cloud customer base would benefit from an enhancement of these functionalities you can raise a feature request via http://influence.sap.com (See notes 2838428,  11 and 2963059 attached) 
These requests are reviewed by our product management and valid cases can be considered for the future product roadmap.

Currently the email templates are quite limited in the standard and they are using CDS views which can not be changed and enhanced. This is indeed causing the issue that custom variables are not passing any data to the email itself.

Best regards,

Krithika

entry.title: Re: Unable to deploy Function Library while Migrating fro...
entry.content:
Hi @NidhiSrivastava ,

I encountered the same error while deploying the function library artifact in CPI.

To resolve this, we need to ensure that the method arguments are of type array (e.g., int[ ]) if the method is a void method.

In my case, the issue was with the argument int max7102. I changed this argument to an integer array, int[ ] max7102, and that resolved the problem.

 

@FunctionLibraryMethod(category = "KA-ODETTE PAC", title = "CreateNCO", executionType = "ALL_VALUES_OF_CONTEXT", key = "calculate1222222222222222222")
    public void CreateNCO(@UDFParam(paramCategory = "Argument", title = "") String[] hlnum, @UDFParam(paramCategory = "Argument", title = "") String[] pckar, @UDFParam(paramCategory = "Argument", title = "") String[] anzar, @UDFParam(paramCategory = "Argument", title = "") String[] exidv, @UDFParam(paramCategory = "Argument", title = "") String[] venum, @UDFParam(paramCategory = "Argument", title = "") String[] zparent, @UDFParam(paramCategory = "Argument", title = "") String[] zpckar, @UDFParam(paramCategory = "Argument", title = "") String[] zanzar, @UDFParam(paramCategory = "Parameter", title = "Max 7102") int[] max7102, @UDFParam(paramCategory = "ResultList", title = "") ResultList result, Container container) throws StreamTransformationException {
       
  //Keeps track of last ANZAR
        String oldAnzar = "";
        //Keeps track of last PCKAR
        String oldPckar = "";
        int lastHlnum = 0;
        int ginCnt = 0;
        int zginCnt = 0;
        int max = max7102[0];
        //counter for boxes
        int zCnt = 0;
        //Indicator, is true only when we go through the first pallet or box
        boolean firstTime = true;
        String lastExidv = "";
        /*Loop through all E1EDP08 (Pallets) */
        for (int i = 0; i < hlnum.length; i++) {
            if (hlnum[i].equals("2")) {
                /*If Pallet has smallboxes on it*/
                /* Loop through all smallboxes on pallet */
                while (venum[i].equals(zparent[zCnt])) {
                    boolean firstTimeForPallet = true;
                    if (((!oldAnzar.equals(zanzar[zCnt]) || !oldPckar.equals(zpckar[zCnt])) && !firstTime) || lastHlnum == 1) {
                        /*If PCKAR or ANZAR has changed make context change to come in correct PAC segment */
                        result.addContextChange();
                        //<--- We want to reset zginCnt when pkcar or anzar changes
                        zginCnt = 0;
                    }
                    /*
								Problem in code if a pallet has 2 or more boxes with different zanzar or zpckar
								We will not create a NCO for the 2nd box since zginCnt will be 0
									
	
							## Code before Change ##
						if((zginCnt % max7102 == 0 && zginCnt > 0)  || !lastExidv.equals(exidv[i]))										
								{
														result.addValue(exidv[i]);
														zginCnt = 0;
								}

								Solution.
								Move in zginCnt so that it will only control if we should reset zginCnt or not.
						*/
                    if (zginCnt % max == 0 || !lastExidv.equals(exidv[i])) {
                        result.addValue(exidv[i]);
                        if (zginCnt > 0) {
                            zginCnt = 0;
                        }
                    }
                    firstTime = false;
                    oldPckar = zpckar[zCnt];
                    oldAnzar = zanzar[zCnt];
                    lastExidv = exidv[i];
                    lastHlnum = 2;
                    zCnt++;
                    zginCnt++;
                    if (zCnt >= zparent.length) {
                        break;
                    }
                }
            } else {
                //Stand alone box or Pallet
                if ((!oldAnzar.equals(anzar[i]) || !oldPckar.equals(pckar[i])) || lastHlnum == 2) {
                    if (!firstTime) {
                        /*If PCKAR or ANZAR has changed make context change to come in correct PAC segment */
                        result.addContextChange();
                    }
                    ginCnt = 0;
                    // don't need to put out master
                    result.addValue(exidv[i]);
                } else {
                    if (ginCnt % max == 0) {
                        // don't need to put out master
                        result.addValue(exidv[i]);
                    }
                }
                firstTime = false;
                oldPckar = pckar[i];
                oldAnzar = anzar[i];
                lastHlnum = 1;
                ginCnt++;
            }
            lastExidv = exidv[i];
        }
    }

Please check the arguments in all the methods of your function library to fix this error.
You may face the same issue with String, int, or Float arguments as well.

Regards,
Praveen

entry.title: Re: 在阿根延，销售发票的代扣代缴税如何实现
entry.content:
Hello @michael_mx 

感谢您的提问.

阿根廷国家特定功能及SIRE社会保障预扣税报告的附加设置
简而言之，当您需要在公共云中处理销售计费流程中的预扣税或代收税时，可通过定价程序中的特殊条件类型实现。
针对您的使用场景，最佳实践如下：
• 使用SAP为阿根廷本地化提供的特殊附加费。例如ZIMP/ZPER（代收税），用于客户代收/代扣税款。
希望以上内容能提供所需见解。欢迎随时提出进一步问题。
此致
敬礼
Chris

Country-Specific Functions for Argentina, Argentina & Making Additional Settings for the SIRE Social Security Withholding Tax Report

Translation aided with GenAi

entry.title: The International 2025 – Review of TI14 with SAP & Team Liquid
entry.content:
The International 2025 – Review of TI14 with SAP & Team Liquid

From September 11 to 14, 2025, the Barclays Arena in Hamburg became the center of the esports world. The International 2025 (TI14), the most important Dota 2 tournament of the year, brought together the 16 best teams. In addition to the legendary Aegis of Champions, a total prize pool of $2,694,437 was up for grabs – funded by Valve's base pool plus community purchases in the Dota client.

Prize pool distribution (Top 4)

Team Falcons – approx. $1,181,757 (43.9% of the pool)
🥈Xtreme Gaming – approx. $305,163
🥉PARiVISION – approx. $192,000
4️⃣BetBoom Team – approx. $128,000
The remaining teams received smaller prize money depending on their ranking.


Viewership & Reach

Peak Viewers: 1.77 million concurrent viewers in the Grand Final.
📊Average Viewers: approximately 835,000 over the entire event.
🌍TI14 was broadcast in more than 20 languages worldwide.

This makes TI14 the third most popular Dota 2 event of all time, just behind TI10 and TI11.

Stadium at The International 2025Team LiquidStadiumPublic View on the Ongoing GamesPublic View on the Ongoing Games


SAP & Team Liquid – Data in Esports

SAP has been working with Team Liquid since 2018, bringing business technology to gaming:

SAP HANA analytics helped Liquid evaluate over 500,000 draft scenarios and better understand opponents' strategies.
Liquid used statistical models to calculate hero pick probabilities – similar to sales or demand forecasts in business.
Even though they didn't make it into the top 4 this year, Liquid was able to show several times during the tournament how data-driven strategies influence drafts and early-game decisions.


Tournament progress – facts and figures

16 teams started in the group stage, which was played using the Swiss system.
A total of 51 matches were played, with an average game duration of 42 minutes.
Longest game: 77 minutes in the lower bracket, a real thriller that tested the nerves of both players and fans.
Most picked hero: Shadow Demon (48 picks, 56% win rate).
Highest KDA (kills/deaths/assists): A Falcons player with 14.2 in the Grand Final.


Significance & outlook

TI14 proved that esports and technology are increasingly converging.
For SAP, the partnership with Team Liquid is a showcase for data-driven innovation.
For fans, Hamburg was a worthy venue with a spine-tingling atmosphere.
TI15 will take place in Shanghai in 2026 – a venue traditionally known for its vocal fans and gigantic arenas.

 

Conclusion

With over $2.6 million in prize money, nearly 2 million live viewers, and thrilling best-of-five series, TI14 was a worthy milestone in Dota 2 history.
Team Falcons will go down in history as the 2025 champions, while Team Liquid, with the help of SAP data analytics, proves that modern esports is not just about reaction time and instinct – but also big data and smart strategy.

entry.title: Unable to Style Extended Header Item and LabelBar in Card Collection in SAP MDK
entry.content:
I'm working with the Card Collection layout in SAP MDK and facing a styling issue. I’m able to successfully style the image inside the ExtendedHeaderItem and the LabelBar in the card body — such as adjusting size and color.

However, I'm unable to apply styling to the text components within these same areas. For example, changes to font size, color, or weight on the header title or label text do not reflect, even though similar styling works for other card elements.

I've tried applying styles via the metadata and using custom style classes, but the text remains unaffected. Is there a specific property or approach required to style text inside ExtendedHeaderItem and LabelBar?

Any insights, examples, or workarounds would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance,

entry.title: What end-to-end testing tools are best for SAP BTP (BAS) applications with CDS views and SAPUI5?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am working on SAP Business Application Studio (BAS) projects deployed on SAP BTP that use CDS views as the data model and SAPUI5 for the front end.

I would like to implement end-to-end testing for these applications. I am familiar with general-purpose tools like Playwright or WebdriverIO, but I am not sure if they are the best fit when testing applications in the SAP ecosystem (especially those with CDS/OData services and SAPUI5).

  • Has anyone successfully used Playwright or WebdriverIO for BAS/SAPUI5 projects?

  • Are there recommended frameworks or libraries specifically designed for UI5 applications?

  • What are the best practices for handling such tests?

  • Any tutorials, examples, or community resources you could share?

Thanks in advance for your insights!

entry.title: How to create a salesorder with i_salesordertp referring to a quotation?
entry.content:
Hi all,

I'm creating a salesorder with EML using i_salesordertp. But it seems I can't refer to a quotation in order to fill the documentflow for the sales order.

Filling the field ReferenceSDDocument itself gives the error "The field "REFERENCESDDOCUMENT" of entity "I_SALESORDERTP" cannot be modified"

And the following example code:

    MODIFY ENTITIES OF i_salesordertp
     ENTITY salesorder
     EXECUTE createwithreference
     FIELDS ( salesdocumenttype
     referencesddocument )

     WITH VALUE #( ( %cid = 'H001'
     %param = VALUE #( salesdocumenttype = 'TA'
     referencesddocument = '0020000011' ) ) )
     MAPPED DATA(ls_mapped)
     FAILED DATA(ls_failed)
     REPORTED DATA(ls_reported).

gives the error "The entity "I_SALESORDERTP" does not have an action "CREATEWITHREFERENCE"".

Can anyone give me a hint on how to use a quotation as reference in i_salesordertp?

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: List of RFC's in SAP Plant Connectivity
entry.content:
Dear

Currently I'm trying to set up a connection between SAP EWM (embedded in S4) and a machine PLC.
For this I created a destination with type 'SAP NW'. But I also tried with 'SAP EWM' and 'SAP ODA'.

The connection is successful. But when I create an agent and then a notification, in the 'Destinations' tab I'm expecting to see a list of RFC's.

But it's not there, I can just select the server and nothing more.

I tested the notification with no RFC selected and in the logs I see that there seems to be an RFC preselected 'S_PCO_RFC_EXECUTE_RECEIVE_EVNT'. I don't know if we can fill in a different RFC somewhere in S4?
I couldn't find any good documentation on how to use this function module to get the data from PCO into the RFC that I need.

entry.title: AR Invoice showing incorrect stock quantity
entry.content:
Dear SAP Team,

We have encountered an issue at our customer related to an AR Invoice.

In the AR, there is a UDF: U_KD_BRNG_PJK Row=1 Variable=11 INV1.U_KD_BRNG_PJK.
For example, in the AR Invoice the value appears as 281100, but when we run a query, the result shows 0.

Our question: why does the query return 0, while in the AR Invoice the value is clearly shown as 281100?

Additional information:

The UDF is Alphanumeric with a length of 20 characters.

This issue only occurs in one invoice.

Thank you for your assistance.

entry.title: quotation error : Unpermitted combination of business object BUS2032 and sales doc. category B
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am facing an issue during the data load of quotations in the Migration Cockpit in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

I get the following error message:
“Unpermitted combination of business object BUS2032 and sales document category B.”

 

I checked an SAP Note which suggests using LTMOM to configure the migration object. However, this object is not editable – I can modify or add fields, but the object itself cannot be changed.

Has anyone faced a similar issue or found a solution? Any guidance would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance,
Mohammed

entry.title: SAP Future Talent: Get started with SAP Ariba | Portuguese

SAP Future Talent: Get started with SAP Ariba

Este treinamento é organizado pela equipe do SAP Future Talent, e estamos felizes em compartilhar essa oportunidade com a nossa comunidade!

Sobre o treinamento:

Participe do treinamento Get started with SAP Ariba, uma capacitação gratuita e online destinada a estudantes, iniciantes em soluções SAP e profissionais em transição de carreira que desejam se aprofundar nos conceitos de compras e supply chain.

O programa apresentará os principais recursos e funcionalidades do SAP Ariba, além de exemplos de integração com outros sistemas SAP e boas práticas de utilização.

Ao final, os participantes receberão um badge digital oficial emitido pela Credly, para valorizar sua trajetória no LinkedIn e no currículo.

Conteúdo:

  • Introdução ao SAP Ariba
  • Funcionalidades principais da solução
  • Foco em compras e supply chain
  • Integração com outros sistemas SAP
  • Boas práticas de uso

Datas e horários:

  • Datas: 13, 15, 20 e 22 de outubro
  • Horário: 18h às 20h30 (GMT-3)
  • Plataforma: Zoom
  • Carga horária: 10 horas (2 semanas – 2 dias por semana)

Inscreva-se agora via https://sap-se.zoom.us/meeting/register/LbpGH5EEQ8uz93VgeWO4vw

entry.title: system change the plant address automatically in a customer address
entry.content:
Hello all,

I have this phenomenon in our SAP S4 HANA system (no retail):


The system change the plant address automatically in a customer address. This came after one year of go-live. One year the plant was correct - without automatically changes. 


If we correct the plant address via OX10 and transport it to our production system, the plant address will be automatically overwritten (every two/three weeks) from transaction VL09 or VL02N (we saw it on the database).
But we don´t find the reason why the system change it automatically. Important to know, this is a trade process. 

Its only for 2 plants - not for all plants. We checked batch jobs, customer-programms, check user behavior and so on.
No solution to find the bug. We also can´t reproduce the error.


Actual we check BAPI_ADDRESSORG_SAVEREPLICA.

Do you have any ideas what is ?


Thanks and best regards,
Sandra

entry.title: Re: Universal OData ↔ MCP Bridge; Or: How I Accidentally Made 15,000 Enterprise Services Talk to AI
entry.content: @bjorn-henrik_zink if you are not mass-extracting data via MCP-OData bridge - you are fine, same for the training. The MCP-OData bridge has nothing to do with training - so no issues there (unless you are explicitly using it for such case).

entry.title: Re: VAT Only Invoice GL Account and Manual Posting
entry.content:
The reason why you were not able to clear the VAT invoice is because, VAT‑only AP invoice posting (via FB60/FB01 with tax code) works because the system posts Vendor line and VAT line (to your new VAT G/L account 1440303). Clearing issue arises because I believe, your VAT G/L account is not flagged as open item managed in FS00. Without open item management, you cannot “clear” individual postings against each other. The account is behaving like a pure P&L/Balance Sheet account, not like a subledger clearing account.

In standard SAP, VAT accounts are not cleared manually. They are periodically reconciled and reported (via tax reports, e.g. RFUMSV00 or DRC in S/4HANA). Payment of VAT to the tax authority is posted separately (Bank → VAT payable), not by “clearing” the VAT G/L.

The standard design is VAT G/L accounts are configured in OB40. When you post an invoice with tax, the system automatically posts to the correct VAT account. When you pay VAT to the tax authority, you post a manual journal entry (Bank → VAT payable). You do not clear the VAT G/L line items; instead, you reconcile via tax reporting.

entry.title: Re: Story Changes Lost in Edit Mode Due to Active Bookmark in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Hello,

I would like to share an observation regarding the feedback mechanism available in the SAC browser. While it is useful for sharing inputs, I feel this channel does not provide the same level of commitment or tracking that a formal support ticket offers. This creates uncertainty, as there is no visibility on whether the feedback will be reviewed, prioritized, or resolved.

To illustrate, I recently encountered an issue with Bookmarks:

  • Formatting changes (text color, font size, layout, etc.) are saved correctly.
  • But when the story is opened in View Mode, a Bookmark seems to be auto-applied, reverting the story to an earlier state.
  • Even in Edit Mode, the story reflects this Bookmark state, and if saved again, the changes appear lost.
  • This is confusing for users who are not aware that a Bookmark is being applied automatically.

Workaround:
For now, I have disabled Bookmarks to avoid these issues. However, this means the whole concept and benefit of using Bookmarks is lost in my case.

In my view, a more structured mechanism is needed. Developers without S-User access cannot raise tickets directly, and feedback submissions do not allow us to track progress or receive commitments on resolution.

Has anyone else in the community faced similar challenges, and how are you addressing them?

Thank you.

entry.title: Re: Transfer of Planned independent Requirement from head...
entry.content:
Have you completed a full cycle test yet including Sales Order Invoicing and posting a Delivery PGI yet? That will tell you where the costs will flow and if there is a problem with having the stock under the grouping WBS. The revenue will post to the WBs assigned in the Sales Order.

The entire solution that many A&D companies use is called PMMO.  Previously it was GPD (Grouping, Pegging, and Distribution).  This is a much more involved solution which I think is too complicated for your needs.

entry.title: Re: External Pricing in C4C Opportunity.
entry.content: Hi KF,

entry.title: Re: SAP GUI checkbox events not received immediately
entry.content:
Hi,

there are different kinds of checkboxes in the Dynpro framework.
Some of them are so-called "Flushing" checkboxes (configuration done in the screenpainter). This kind of checkboxes causes a round-trip to the application server when their state is getting changed. The intention is that application can react immediately on this change. However, this causes additional network traffic and therefore should be avoided if not needed.
This is why most checkboxes are not "Flushing" and their status change is only sent to the server when the next round-trip is triggered for example when a button is clicked. Since SAP GUI Scripting emulates the normal SAP GUI behavior what you described is the expected situation for non-Flushing checkboxes.

Best regards,
Frank

entry.title: SAP Fiori development newsletter September2025 (issue #36)
entry.content:
With summer vacations ending for many of us and school starting the fall term, that means that we are entering conference season. Between now and the end of the year, we have SAP TechEd in Berlin and virtual, several SAP TechEd on Tour events around the world, and two SAP Fiori Innovation Days. While you can expect most of the big product announcements to happen at the larger events, we still have some innovations that you can read about below. Have you experimented with MCP servers yet? If not, what are you waiting for?

For ongoing updates, I encourage you to join our monthly SAP Fiori development roundtable. Register online or email me for an invitation.

If you prefer to receive this in your inbox, please subscribe to the SAP Fiori development newsletter.

Development news

SAP Fiori tools update – First release of the Fiori MCP Server for Agentic AI workflows

The new Fiori MCP Server offers a new capability that lets Agentic AI tools directly create and edit SAP Fiori applications. Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open standard that standardizes how applications provide context to large language models. MCP is already supported by clients such as Claude, Cline, Cursor, and VS Code, allowing AI-powered workflows to interact seamlessly with developer tools. Learn More: 
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-fiori-tools-update-first-release-of-the-sap-fiori-mcp-server-for/ba-p/14204694

SAP Build introduces new MCP Servers to enable agentic development for Enterprise Applications

Agentic AI application development is rapidly becoming an integral part of the development process, helping teams to boost productivity, reduce errors, and innovate faster than ever. With that in mind, SAP is introducing Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers to boost development with Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP), SAP Fiori Elements, and SAPUI5. Read about this open-source initiative.
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-build-introduces-new-mcp-servers-to-enable-agentic-development-for/ba-p/14205602

Open Source MCP Server can ingest SAP documentation

Marian Zeis shares his SAP Documentation MCP Server, a fast, lightweight way to give LLMs grounded access to official SAP docs, API references, real sample code, the SAP Community, and SAP Help. Less hunting through tabs, more precise answers right inside your AI tool. Read more: 
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/feed-sap-help-ui5-apis-amp-sap-community-content-into-your-ai-with-this/ba-p/14195007

Prevent an SAP Fiori / SAPUI5 downtime — check your browser strategy today

SAP Fiori / SAPUI5 applications in productive SAP solutions require a minimum browser version to ensure full availability and security. Learn from a recent case in SAP's customer support and make sure your business users are up to date with their browsers and operating systems. Check your browser version: 
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/prevent-an-sap-fiori-sapui5-downtime-check-your-browser-strategy-today/ba-p/14192361

How key users create consistent text changes with SAPUI5 flexibility

To tailor an app for many end users, key users can easily change e.g. the texts of standard SAP apps. SAPUI5 flexibility has a new capability to change these text and their arrangement in a consistent way, across multiple fields. See the details:
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/how-key-users-create-consistent-text-changes-with-sapui5-flexibility/ba-p/14177155

Try SAP Joule for Developers — now available for free

We have recently introduced powerful new Joule capabilities for developers across SAP Build Code, SAP Build Process Automation, SAP Build Apps, and ABAP environment. These AI features are designed to accelerate development, boost productivity, and bring intelligence into the tools you already use. Try it today:
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/unlock-sap-joule-for-developers-claim-your-free-access-today/ba-p/14183158

SAPUI5 1.138 restructures key help topics for SAP Fiori elements

With SAPUI5 1.138, the SAP Fiori elements OData V4 “Field Help” documentation has undergone a complete revamp! It’s essentially the same contents but with a much better restructuring of the key topics. The flow of topics is a lot more natural and in sync with the way the field help shows up in the UI – resulting in a far better readability of the topic. Learn more:
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/valuehelp-docu-it-s-just-the-old-wine-in-a-new-bottle-but-then-every-bottle/ba-p/14151332

Events

Register (customers and sponsoring partners only): 
​https://events.asug.com/event/219d5e39-0d00-4534-b19e-6f0f4704de38/home

Register (customers and sponsoring partners only): 
​https://events.sap.com/eur-fiori-innovation-day-walldorf-2025/en_us/home.html

SAP TechEd registration is open

SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori development sessions at SAP TechEd Berlin

Hands-on workshops

  • AD166: Taking UI to the next level: Develop SAPUI5 with SAP Build 
  • AD260: UI extensibility on top of cloud and ABAP: What's in it for you 
  • AD163: Fusion development with ABAP Cloud in SAP Build
  • CA261: Create great UX with AI, SAP Design System, SAP Fiori elements, and SAPUI5 

Deep-dive sessions

  • AD106: The art and science of SAPUI5 in SAP Build
  • AD203: Fact-checking UI extensibility on cloud and ABAP: What's in it for you
  • CA105: Intelligent app development at scale with AI and SAP Fiori elements
  • AD201: Explore ABAP Cloud in SAP Build: What's in it for ABAP developers 

Back issues from the past year

SAP Fiori development newsletter July 2025 (issue #35)

SAP FIori development newsletter May 2025 (Issue #34)

SAP Fiori development newsletter March 2025 (Issue #33)

SAP Fiori development newsletter January 2025 (issue #32)

SAP Fiori development newsletter November 2024 (issue #31)

SAP Fiori development newsletter September 2024 (issue #30)

entry.title: Fiori VA01 WebGUI – Quantity field input lost when entering material and quantity quickly
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

we recently went live with S/4HANA and are using the VA01 transaction via WebGUI, exposed as a tile in the Fiori Launchpad.

We are experiencing a usability issue during fast order entry in the item section of VA01:

  • The sales colleague enters a material number, presses Enter, and immediately types the quantity (e.g., "100").

  • The problem is: only "00" appears in the quantity field — the first digit is lost.

  • This seems to be caused by the asynchronous loading of material master data, which overwrites the manually typed quantity.

This issue did not exist in ECC with classic SAP GUI, where fast blind typing worked fine. Our sales team needs to work quickly, entering multiple line items during customer calls, and this behavior is significantly slowing them down.

SAP support has confirmed the behavior but unfortunately stated that no correction is currently planned.

Has anyone experienced a similar issue or found a workaround?
Any suggestions (e.g. technical workaround, enhancement option, or front-end trick) would be highly appreciated!

 

 

Best regards,

ChG

entry.title: Re: Automatic Sales order exctraction
entry.content:
Dear @SKAE ,
I hope you are doing great.

The intelligent scenario SAP_COM_1129 is a SAP managed scenario, therefore, you need to request the activation of this scenario via ticket to SAP support under the component XX-S4C-OPR-SRV.

Once the scenario and default version are setup by SAP team, you can proceed with the setup according to the setup instructions: Setting Up Create Sales Orders from Unstructured Data (4X9)

If you have further questions or issues, the bellow documentation might be helpful:

  • Create Sales Orders - Automatic Extraction | SAP Help Portal
  • KBA 3452093 - Communication arrangement SAP_COM_1129 is not available
  • KBA 3542678 - Error "Connectivity with Document Information Extraction Service Instance: Connection fails." after activating scope item 4X9
  • KBA 3444900 - Not able to find the Fiori app by searching with "Create Sales Orders from Unstructured Data"

Kind regards,
Luiza.

entry.title: Re: Fiori VA01 WebGUI – Quantity field input lost when en...
entry.content:
Hello @ChG 

I guess it is related to WebGUI response time. It will always be longer than SAP GUI response time. As WebGUI needs to get a screen, analyze it,translate it to an HTML page, then the page is sent to a web browser and the browser needs to render the page. It does take time. 

You might try to optimize that - see the note 2424394 - How to investigate response times of HTTP-based front end UIs with ABAP-based backend systems However the best solution in my opinion is just to use SAP GUI, especially that the problem is not there. 

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Re: How to post UD for inspection lot with serial number management by using API?
entry.content:
The error message "QV / 053" indicates that a usage decision (UD) and stock posting for an inspection lot require a manual serial number assignment. This is a common issue in SAP's Quality Management (QM) module, particularly when dealing with serialized materials. The message is considered "self-explanatory" by SAP, which means there's no additional help text available directly within the system. To resolve this, you generally need to address the manual serial number assignment for the material in question. This can be done by looking up the specific inspection lot and performing the necessary steps to assign the serial numbers before completing the usage decision. In some cases, this error may be related to BAPI functions (like BAPI_INSPLOT_SETUSAGEDECISION) or specific configurations related to stock postings and serialization. Searching for SAP Notes on this specific error code (QV053) on the SAP Support Portal is a recommended step for finding a solution. If you are dealing with this in the context of an Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) environment, the problem might be linked to the interaction between the QM and EWM modules. i need figure out how to configured the QM - EWM interface...

Adilson

entry.title: Re: The upload file name is missing in object page when f...
entry.content:
Hi,

A solution that worked for me:

I extended the object page of the ROOT entity,
and overrode the client-side upload function to update the file name after uploading.

Code Snippet (Controller Extension):
Remember to change the value ​​of the following variable according to your application.
sFileNameField( "File Name" field here as it appears in the CDS).

sap.ui.define(['sap/ui/core/mvc/ControllerExtension' ],  function (ControllerExtension) {
    'use strict';

    return ControllerExtension.extend('studentapp.ext.controller.StudentObjectPage', {
        override: {
            /**
             * Called when a controller is instantiated and its View controls (if available) are already created.
             * Can be used to modify the View before it is displayed, to bind event handlers and do other one-time initialization.
             * @memberOf studentapp.ext.controller.StudentObjectPage
             */
            onInit: function () {
                //Fix bug file fame not set 
                this.getInterface().fixBugFileNameNotSet();
            },

        },

        fixBugFileNameNotSet: function () {

            if (!sap.ui.unified.FileUploader.prototype._bUploadOverwritten) {

                sap.ui.unified.FileUploader.prototype._bUploadOverwritten = true;
                var fOrignalUpload = sap.ui.unified.FileUploader.prototype.upload;
				
                sap.ui.unified.FileUploader.prototype.upload = function (bPreProcessFiles) {

                    /* Extend - Begin */
                
					//fix Bug File Name Not Set
					if (!this._bUploadCompleteAttached) {
						this.attachUploadComplete(function (oEvent) {
							var sFileNameField = "file_name", //Put here the name of your Porperty of the file name
								sFileName = oEvent.getParameter("fileName");

							this.getBindingContext().setProperty(sFileNameField, sFileName)
						}, this);
						this._bUploadCompleteAttached = true;
					}
					
                    /* Extend - End */
                    

                    fOrignalUpload.apply(this, arguments);

                };
            }
        }
    });
});

Best Regards,
Ben.
